TopicTitle: Wait, if Kerbals have cylindrical heads, why do they have spherical helmets?

Articles.Content:
Wait, if Kerbals have cylindrical heads, why do they have spherical helmets? 

I just noticed this.

Maybe that's why they don't need oxygen, because of all the extra space in the helmet! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
They have spherical helmets so that they can bounce from great heights. Obviously! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

The spherical helmet is more pressure resistant, has the largest amount of volume for it's mass, has the fewest edges or corners that can bump or catch on obstructions, and is less likely to have weak spots that deform or break under impact.
I always thought it was so that they could keep rolling downhill with as little resistance as possible. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
